#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Crosby
#Text=Crosby is a town in Merseyside .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Crosby does n't have an airport , but Liverpool Airport is within under an hour 's drive .
#Text=If coming from inside of the North West of England , then Merseyrail offer the cheapest train rides in the country .
#Text=Train stations in Crosby include Hall Road , Blundellsands and Crosby and Waterloo .
#Text=See
#Text=♡❤♡Anthony Gormley 's Another Place ♡❤♡ .
#Text=Many visitors visit Crosby because of the sculptures all over Crosby Beach .

#Text=The Captain of the Titanic lived on Marine Crescent in Waterloo and this road , together with neighbouring Marine Terrace , Adelaide Terrace and Beach Lawn provide some excellent examples of Georgian and Victorian architecture .
#Text=The Ismay family , owners of the White Star line which owned the Titanic , lived at Beach Lawn , Waterloo .
#Text=Do
#Text=Lakeside Adventure Centre , Waterloo .
#Text=A large fully equipped gym and a centre of excellence for water sports , using the marine lake .
#Text=It provides special assistance for the disabled .
#Text=It also has a bistro/bar and 16 bedrooms .
#Text=The promenade stretches from Seaforth Radar Tower at Waterloo all the way up to Hall Road Coastguard Station .
#Text=This is an interesting walk in all types of weather , but it can get very windy !
#Text=The prom is a good vantage point for viewing the iron men .
#Text=Eat
#Text=The Pioneer .
#Text=Amazing brasserie who also do functions for all occasions .
#Text=One of the few eating and drinking establishments open until very late .
#Text=Drink
#Text=Crosby has a flourishing bar scene .
#Text=Although a little quiet at times during the week , weekends are usually standing room-only in the village .
#Text=Top watering holes include :
#Text=George Hotel .
#Text=Very popular with a ( often very ) young crowd at the weekends .
#Text=Good for cheap eats during the day .
#Text=Blues ' Bar .
#Text=Good laid back atmosphere with a mixed crowd .
#Text=The Village .
#Text=Grab a granny .
#Text=The Grafton of the north end .
#Text=Stamps .
#Text=Nice split level bar with excellent kitchen .
#Text=Sophisticated crowd , quiz nights on Wednesday .
#Text=The Crosby .
#Text=Real boozer very good for the football .
#Text=Especially popular with the blue half of the population .
#Text=The Birkey .
#Text=Some would say the premier pub in the area .
#Text=Split between a very comfortable lounge and a slightly grungy rock bar .
#Text=Good times to be had by all .
#Text=The Crow 's Nest .
#Text=One of the few remaining traditional pubs in the area .
#Text=Unchanged for many years , this establishment has a very loyal following .
#Text=Call in for a pint of excellent beer , but do n't count on a seat any night of the week !
#Text=Sleep
#Text=The Royal Hotel , Waterloo .
#Text=22 bedrooms and a good standard restaurant .
#Text=The bar is well frequented during day and evenings by locals as well as residents
#Text=Stay safe
#Text=Crosby is an affluent and safe area .
